entries.decision: When implementation changes alter governance/process behavior, capture and promote a decision artifact before closeout.
entries.rationale: Prevents important operating decisions from being implicit in diffs and improves traceability across policy/runtime.
entries.title: Require decision reflection for operating-layer changes

entries.decision: Adopt a pinned dev dependency group in pyproject and require uv run --locked --group dev for quality-gate test execution.
entries.rationale: Ensures deterministic pytest/toolchain resolution across local and CI runs; avoids floating uv run --with pytest behavior.
entries.title: Use locked dev dependency group for pytest

entries.decision: Set governance completeness and enforceability as higher priority than coach/cortex decoupling; decoupling milestones depend on active governance-completeness checks.
entries.rationale: Recent misses showed that integrity checks pass even when decision capture completeness is incomplete; priority must shift to close this governance gap first.
entries.title: Prioritize governance completeness over decoupling

entries.decision: Remove in-repo coach runtime fallback and make cortex coach entrypoints delegate to installed standalone cortex-coach; finalize ownership-boundary governance docs.
entries.rationale: Phase 3 parity is complete and standalone coach is operational; retaining internal runtime risks boundary drift.
entries.title: Complete phase 4 external-only coach delegation

entries.decision: Adopt assistant-neutral reflect->abstract->generalize->encode->validate loop and encode outputs in operating artifacts.
entries.rationale: Ensure reflection governance portability across agents and keep durable repo-based memory.
entries.title: Require agent-agnostic reflection loop for governance learning

entries.decision: Remove stale local cortex-coach entrypoint metadata, install standalone coach in CI, and call delegator via python3 to avoid uv shadowing side effects.
entries.rationale: Prevents ModuleNotFoundError from broken local script shadowing and aligns execution with external-only coach ownership.
entries.title: Fix decoupled coach entrypoint shadowing in CI and scripts

entries.decision: All non-interactive coach commands must support --format text|json with default text preserved; temporary delegator output shims are allowed until standalone parity is complete.
entries.rationale: Automation and governance checks require deterministic machine-parseable outputs, and backward compatibility prevents breaking existing text-mode workflows.
entries.title: Require universal JSON format contract for non-interactive coach commands

entries.decision: Project-specific operational artifacts must live under .cortex by default, with fail-closed boundary checks and time-bounded waiver exceptions.
entries.rationale: Protect distribution surfaces from project-state drift and keep repository authority boundaries deterministic for maintainers and downstream adopters.
entries.title: Enforce project-state boundary under .cortex

entries.decision: Normalize legacy governance/playbook references to remove artifact-conformance drift signals while preserving policy intent and project-boundary defaults.
entries.rationale: Audit findings were dominated by legacy reference-path and foreign project token patterns in non-executable docs. Remediation keeps enforcement focused on actionable drift and restores clean audit baselines.
entries.title: Artifact conformance remediation pass for legacy governance docs

entries.decision: Adopt PH0-012 context hydration baseline with policy, schema, and spec integration, with runtime enforcement staged separately.
entries.rationale: This prevents governance drift from stale context windows while keeping rollout incremental and auditable.
entries.title: Establish context hydration contract and policy baseline

entries.decision: Mistake observed: Temporal Cortex-development playbooks lacked explicit lifecycle metadata and deterministic release-surface enforcement. Recurring pattern: Project-scoped playbooks drift into durable release surface when temporal status and expiry are not contract-bound. Adopt reusable rule: Require contract-managed lifecycle metadata for cortex_* playbooks and fail closed on unmanaged, expired, or disposition-violating entries.
entries.rationale: Promote durable, auditable learning so repeated mistakes are prevented across sessions.
entries.title: Enforce temporal playbook retirement and release-surface gating

entries.decision: Define PH0-006 governance controls so stop-rule ownership remains in cortex policy while kill-switch execution remains in cortex-coach operations, with explicit stabilization-cycle requirements.
entries.rationale: Explicit ownership and recovery flow reduce emergency-response ambiguity and prevent governance bypass during incident handling.
entries.title: Define kill-switch ownership split and stabilization rollback procedure

entries.decision: Define PH0-007 capacity governance cadence with explicit /status/dashboard checkpoints, mandatory mid-week pressure downgrade behavior, and review-load guardrails tied to the current planning baseline.
entries.rationale: Explicit cadence controls reduce limit-pressure regressions and protect governance gate discipline during multi-week execution.
entries.title: Formalize Codex Plus capacity governance cadence for weekly execution

entries.decision: Define PH0-011 Swarm-GDD baseline with normative swarm governance rules, explicit local/CI gate mapping, adoption stop-rule, and a verified end-to-end closeout sequence artifact.
entries.rationale: This makes swarm adoption fail-closed, preserves governance-plane authority, and prevents premature default-on swarm rollout.
entries.title: Formalize Swarm-GDD baseline gates and adoption stop-rule

entries.decision: Define PH0-014 mistake provenance contract and policy, require schema-compliant candidate records for machine-caught claims, and enforce fail-closed provenance checks in local and CI quality gates.
entries.rationale: This removes ambiguity around agent-caught mistake claims and prevents ungrounded assertions from passing governance closeout.
entries.title: Enforce machine-verifiable mistake provenance for agent-caught claims

entries.decision: Define PH0-008 verification policy to allow only explicitly-owned/time-bounded residual gaps with required metadata, while prohibiting authority/safety/release-gate failures from non-blocking treatment.
entries.rationale: This preserves governance rigor while allowing controlled forward progress on non-critical unresolved items.
entries.title: Adopt owned-and-time-bounded residual-gap policy for PH0 verification

entries.decision: Mistake observed: Phase 0 handoff could be interpreted as complete without a deterministic entry-condition checklist, increasing risk of ambiguous Phase 1 start criteria. Recurring pattern: Narrative handoff summaries without explicit pass/fail entry conditions make readiness judgments inconsistent across sessions and maintainers. Adopt reusable rule: PH0 handoff must include a mandatory Phase 1 entry-condition checklist with pass/fail status and evidence links, plus owned open-question registry.
entries.rationale: Promote durable, auditable learning so repeated mistakes are prevented across sessions.
entries.title: Require mandatory Phase 1 entry checklist in Phase 0 handoff

entries.decision: Mistake observed: Phase 1 implementation could start without a shared command-family contract baseline, causing inconsistent command semantics and weak automation guarantees. Recurring pattern: Feature design starts before a common CLI/output/exit-code contract exists, leading to drift across commands and reviews. Adopt reusable rule: Before implementing a new command family, publish a shared contract baseline and measurement gate criteria, then link them to execution tickets.
entries.rationale: Promote durable, auditable learning so repeated mistakes are prevented across sessions.
entries.title: Establish Phase 1 tactical memory command-family baseline and measurement gate

entries.decision: Mistake observed: Phase 1 memory-record contract work touched tactical data policy without explicit decision linkage, risking undocumented governance drift. Recurring pattern: Schema and policy evolve during design tickets, but decision linkage is missed when only one governance file is already linked. Adopt reusable rule: When a Phase ticket updates tactical data policy or other governance-impact files, capture and promote a decision that links all changed governance artifacts before closeout.
entries.rationale: Promote durable, auditable learning so repeated mistakes are prevented across sessions.
entries.title: Require schema-bound memory-record policy invariants before Phase 1 implementation

entries.decision: Back-link cortex-coach Phase 1 runtime commits into cortex governance artifacts and mark runtime handoff completed with explicit gate evidence.
entries.rationale: Preserves auditable traceability from contract decisions to runtime delivery and closeout evidence.
entries.title: Record Phase 1 runtime implementation backlinks and handoff completion

entries.decision: Record PH2-001/002/003 completion state with cross-repo evidence commits before proceeding to PH2-004+.
entries.rationale: Plan-state mutations under governance paths must remain decision-linked to satisfy gap enforcement and keep execution traceable.
entries.title: Mark Phase 2 retrieval kickoff and weighting implementation as tracked

entries.decision: Mistake observed: PH2 CI overhead measurement exceeded target because required CI gate was carrying full coach test matrix scope. Recurring pattern: Required and full-matrix gate responsibilities drifted together over time, increasing required CI runtime beyond budget. Adopt reusable rule: Keep required CI on governance-critical focused tests and run full coach matrix in dedicated full gate script for release-grade coverage.
entries.rationale: Promote durable, auditable learning so repeated mistakes are prevented across sessions.
entries.title: Maintain split CI and full-matrix quality gates for overhead control

entries.decision: Mistake observed: Phase 3 adapter kickoff changes touched governance-impacting docs/playbooks without fresh decision linkage. Recurring pattern: When starting a new phase, planning/spec artifacts can be added before a decision entry captures authority and scope boundaries. Adopt reusable rule: When opening a new phase board or measurement plan, capture and promote a decision linking all governance-impacting kickoff artifacts in the same change.
entries.rationale: Promote durable, auditable learning so repeated mistakes are prevented across sessions.
entries.title: Kick off Phase 3 work-graph adapter contract and implementation baseline

entries.decision: Mistake observed: Plan-level governance artifacts were changed without a linked promoted decision. Recurring pattern: Roadmap and ticket-board updates can drift from decision coverage when added quickly. Adopt reusable rule: When governance-impact playbooks or roadmap artifacts change, capture+promote a linked decision in the same change set.
entries.rationale: Promote durable, auditable learning so repeated mistakes are prevented across sessions.
entries.title: Formalize remaining Phase 4/5 execution plan artifacts

entries.decision: Mistake observed: Phase 4 baseline and governance roster updates were not yet codified as promoted decision-linked artifacts. Recurring pattern: Planning and governance updates can land quickly without explicit decision/reflection linkage for all affected control artifacts. Adopt reusable rule: When phase baselines or maintainer-governance mappings change, capture and promote a linked decision in the same change set.
entries.rationale: Promote durable, auditable learning so repeated mistakes are prevented across sessions.
entries.title: Establish Phase 4 baseline contract/fixtures and close backup-maintainer gap

entries.decision: Mark PH5-003 and PH5-004 complete with migration/handoff and cross-project reference evidence, and advance immediate next actions to PH5-005/PH5-006 reliability cycles while keeping default mode blocked.
entries.rationale: Phase 5 baseline implementation is complete across contract, runtime, migration, and reference layers; governance sequencing should now move to reliability-cycle evidence.
entries.title: Finalize Phase 5 rollout migration baseline and immediate sequence closeout

entries.decision: Gate F metrics are satisfied for both required reliability cycles; adopt default rollout mode with reversible controls and audited transition evidence.
entries.rationale: Phase 5 objectives are complete with two stable cycles, zero stop-rule incidents, pass adoption/overhead metrics, and complete transition-audit coverage.
entries.title: Close Phase 5 Gate F and authorize default mode

entries.decision: Publish module labs (M2-M5) with deterministic command checklists, expected outputs, and exit evidence; mark CT-004 complete and unblock pilot calibration.
entries.rationale: Training enablement requires operationally testable labs so client onboarding outcomes are reproducible and governance-safe.
entries.title: Add deterministic client onboarding lab pack for modules M2-M5

entries.decision: Mark CT-005 complete with calibrated findings and carry command compatibility/bootstrap remediations into CT-006 gating scope.
entries.rationale: Pilot evidence validates rubric strictness and exposes deterministic blockers that must be closed before client rollout.
entries.title: CT-005 calibration complete; defer external rollout until CT-006 remediations

entries.decision: Introduce a required command-surface preflight script and enforce its use before M2 and M4 labs.
entries.rationale: CT-005 pilot showed command capability drift can invalidate onboarding runs; preflight blocks early and provides deterministic remediation guidance.
entries.title: Gate onboarding labs with command-surface preflight

entries.decision: Use a dedicated certification-pack script to generate scorecard, validate schema, and enforce recurring post-onboarding cadence checks.
entries.rationale: This consolidates onboarding pass/fail logic into a deterministic artifact and keeps cadence governance machine-checkable.
entries.title: Adopt automated onboarding certification pack for CT-006
